chunks.en: MasterCard official website activity database suspected of being leaked. If you participated in the Master Hong Kong card cashback event last year, please lock your card and report the loss in time.

chunks.en:
Last year, MasterCard had an event where each card could get 10% cashback on RMB consumption in mainland China, and you needed to enter your card number and CVV on the official website to register.

https://redemption.mastercard.com/

Recently, it was revealed that registered cards have been stolen in batches. Some cards were only registered on the official website and never used. After cross-validation and reconciliation with netizens, it is basically locked that the official website data was leaked.

Netizens who have participated in this event, please remember to pay attention to your account changes, and lock and report the loss in time.
The activity registration also requires CVV registration, unbelievable!
@explon #3 IQ test fieldğŸ˜‚
Nothing has happened to me yet, I always deposit just the right amount.
No wonder my card was stolen last month.
Wasn't it stolen by Meituan?
HSBC's Blue Lion card has a high rate of fraud, it's like a dream if MC official website stole your card.
Isn't sensitive data encrypted?
I was charged even though I didn't sign up.
It's not surprising that any problems occur with credit cards, such garbage technology.
@bccah Where is 'HSBC', 'Blue Lion', or 'official website theft' mentioned? If you don't understand, have a good dream and wake up to look again. B first to show respect~
@Wyatt Integrated from various channels and finally summarized here. The previous Keeta leak was another wave.
I really can't understand why CVV is required for activity registration.
@bccah So you mean HSBC itself committed the fraud?
Registered for the first time last night... Woke up and saw this today ğŸ¤¦ I have set a limit on the card, hope everything is okay.

The original post should be the one I posted: https://x.com/taresky/status/1885497661828313466. There have been enough cross-discussions. Judge for yourself whose fault it is of this website. The original post and this post are just reminders. Forcing the idea that the official website = safe, most likely hasn't graduated yet.
@taresky Do you think it must be a leak from one party?
The OP is such a garbage information porter. If they can't win the argument, they won't "b".
Can only closing online transactions avoid fraud? Locking the card is a bit troublesome, and if it is not unlocked in time, it will become a report of loss.
Didn't participate last year, but what about those who participated this year? How big is the impact?
@docx The card number and CVV are not used for online transactions that directly connect to banks in China, right? Reporting the loss and changing the card number is safer.
